commentary: McKay to Pietersen, FOUR runs lovely from Pietersen. whips this from well outside off stump with a strong flick of the bottom hand through midwicket
text: lovely from Pietersen. whips this from well outside off stump with a strong flick of the bottom hand through midwicket

commentary: McKay to Pietersen, no run on a length outside off, this time he shoulders arms...decent carry through to Wade
text: on a length outside off, this time he shoulders arms...decent carry through to Wade

commentary: McKay to Pietersen, OUT what a shambles! The ball bobbles into the leg side off the thigh pad, Pietersen wanted to keep strike, Carberry wasn't moving at the non-striker's end and by the time he did set off Pietersen was almost down to meet him. McKay had plenty of time to run from his follow through, pick up the ball, and make his way to the stumps. Carberry leaves fuming. He reckons he's been sold down the river by KP. Did look like a single if Carberry had gone straight away

commentary: Johnson to Pietersen, no run beats him straight away with a very full delivery outside off, hint of swing, Wade starts an appeal but Pietersen wasn't near it

commentary: McKay to Pietersen, no run big appeal! No shot from Pietersen. He padded up to this delivery which nipped back from a full length outside off. Aleem Dar shakes his head. Clarke doesn't review. Replays show it was missing off stump

commentary: Johnson to Pietersen, OUT miscued pull and Pietersen is out, simply caught at square leg! MJ has beaten KP for pace there, the ball was on to him before he got through the stroke, came off the bat near the splice and looped gently, straight to the man on the edge of the ring. England's experimental opening pair are back in the lab

commentary: Johnson to Trott, no run skidding on, Trott plays across his pads and is pinned on the crease - up goes the finger but Trott decides to review! The only question really is whether it pitched outside leg, the ball clearly would have demolished leg stump ... but the replays show definitively that it landed outside the line of leg before striking the pad. Trott took a while consulting with Root before playing the DRS card but it was a sound review

commentary: Johnson to Trott, no run Trott is caught walking in front of his stumps again, this time umpire Gough turns down the appeal - once burned and all that - but Australia decide to review. This is definitely in line but height may well be a question, it hit Trott above the knee roll ... and Hawk-Eye shows it clipping the bail over middle and leg, it's orange, so umpire's call and the not-out decision stands
